question: Some students tend to travel after finishing school and spend time working somewhereinstead of going to the university directly. What are the advantages and disadvantages ofthis development? (May 2021)Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledgeor experience
text: Exploring new places will be really important for every individual. Few high school youngsters are very interested to go on vacations and also, doing some internships or part-time jobs compared to admitting into some colleges soon after finishing their school studies In this essay, will discuss both merits and demerits of the above statement giving a few instances.

Firstly, Nowadays, people are started travelling and exploring new places especially young students, this trend was really started way back in the 17th century and people who are from western countries more tend to visit new locations across other continents slowly, this trend is passed on to the other middle-east countries. The main advantage for students who travel more is they will experience different cultures, cuisines, and lifestyles.

Some other new generation students are also taking up some part-time jobs in private organisations. By this, they will meet many people during their internship and students will gain industry knowledge which will be really helpful for their future endeavours For example, A high school student after completing his 12th standard thereafter, immediately applied for freelancing jobs through an employment portal. Soon after sending the application to a digital marketing company, they accept and is hired as a marketing associate. During 3 months temporary job the young student dealt with many customers and resolved their issues on time. This job experience helped to crack many competitive exams after university studies.
